Did someone try to play Curse of Strahd with Dungeon World rules? Which fronts would you choose? I guess it would be better to let the players find diferent ways to exit Barovia apart from the regular one(that is to kill strahd). What do you think? I would like to ver your experiencies.

<div id='comment z120wpwadqyccbnpk04cijaz4qbehpnj3wc0k'>

<div id='comment z120wpwadqyccbnpk04cijaz4qbehpnj3wc0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/116013665970125878211_photo.jpg'> Yochai Gal</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-03-11 12:53:00 (edited: 2017-03-11 12:53:00)</cite></p>
        <p>Some thoughts:<br /><br />In CoS, the players can really go anywhere they want in Barovia. The Tarroka cards help determine where some of the key elements are, of course - an ally, a powerful item, the location of a secret weapon,  and Strahd&#39;s grave. You could work those into the game, and then just &quot;leave blanks&quot; - and it would work pretty well! There are a couple of key &quot;Fronts&quot; that should happen; most of what happens ins Vallaki and Krezk is necessary;  also Argynvostholt and Castle Ravenloft. You can keep things like The Wizard of Wines storyline and the Amber Temple out of it, I think.<br /><br />Fronts would be: Strahd, as he toys with the players; The Druid Cultists; and maybe the Revenants.</p>
</div>
